attributes.action: Reform the council tax, allowing for opt-out facilities whereby users may pay per use for all appropriate council services, such as refuse collection
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is much in the news about problems with refuse collection, and recycling.

This petition aims to publicise the problems, and suggest an alternative, whereby the user pays for the actual services used, proportional to usage, rather than the current flat fee based on property value.

It is also proposed to extend this idea to other appropriate council services.

Credits may be gained by the user for providing reductions to the council costs, such as recycling, car-pooling, volunteer work, neighbourhood watch, etc.

This is based on the philosophy that society needs to learn responsibility for their actions, and to raise awareness of this from within.
